page.title: 13Changing Longworth (Home)
page.content: There have been quite a few changes in recent years. Most families were much larger with sometimes thirteen children or more.It was often hard to feed so many and they would not have roast meat except for a special treat. There were no washing machines and clothes had to be washed by hand. The chapel was the school in those days and to get to school the children had to walk.After school the pupils would sit against the wall and people used to give them a drink if they held out their tin cups. In the school there were about eighty children. Of course most children had pocket money like they do now but to get their money they had to do jobs for it like picking strawberries or helping the farmer.
